da1ecdb2a532.fact: Albert Einstein (14 March 1879 – 18 April 1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity.

9627add4d6e1.fact: Born in the German Empire, Einstein moved to Switzerland in 1895, forsaking his German citizenship (as a subject of the Kingdom of Württemberg) the following year.

3a3e9768f1c7.fact: In 1897, at the age of seventeen, he enrolled in the mathematics and physics teaching diploma program at the Swiss federal polytechnic school in Zurich, graduating in 1900.

b75462d7d427.fact: In 1905, he submitted a successful PhD dissertation to the University of Zurich.

c3f03cef13aa.fact: In 1914, he moved to Berlin to join the Prussian Academy of Sciences and the Humboldt University of Berlin, becoming director of the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Physics in 1917; he also became a German citizen again, this time as a subject of the Kingdom of Prussia.

813d275310bd.fact: In 1933, while Einstein was visiting the United States, Adolf Hitler came to power in Germany.

4a38c9c05995.key: Horrified by the Nazi persecution of his fellow Je
4a38c9c05995.fact: Horrified by the Nazi persecution of his fellow Jews, he decided to remain in the US, and was granted American citizenship in 1940.

31ab4e5a77f4.key: In them, he outlined a theory of the photoelectric
31ab4e5a77f4.fact: In them, he outlined a theory of the photoelectric effect, explained Brownian motion, introduced his special theory of relativity, and demonstrated that if the special theory is correct, mass and energy are equivalent to each other.

2dcb011b368f.fact: In 1915, he proposed a general theory of relativity that extended his system of mechanics to incorporate gravitation.

abe7b860b88d.key: It introduced the cosmological constant and
abe7b860b88d.fact: It introduced the cosmological constant and is further regarded as the first step in the field of modern theoretical cosmology.

9d3961b23666.fact: In 1917, Einstein wrote a paper which introduced the concepts of spontaneous emission and stimulated emission, the latter of which is the core mechanism behind the laser and maser, and which contained a trove of information that would be beneficial to developments in physics later on, such as quantum electrodynamics and quantum optics.

c719b1a86b35.fact: Especially notable was his work on the quantum physics of radiation, in which light consists of particles, subsequently called photons.

6c4b70a9baed.fact: Many things are named after him, including the element Einsteinium.

736895274898.fact: In 1999, he was named Time's Person of the Century.

97137b2f4d65.fact: The 1901 Nobel Prize in Physics was presented in a ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden to the German Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen, "in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by the discovery of the remarkable rays subsequently named after him", namely, X-rays.

0d149b90e739.fact: It was originally published in 1987; a revised edition appeared in 2007.

6678fcc36411.fact: The 1921 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to the French author Anatole France (1844–1924) "in recognition of his brilliant literary achievements, characterized as they are by a nobility of style, a profound human sympathy, grace, and a true Gallic temperament".

0c00a397ee40.key: France, officially the French Republic, is a count
0c00a397ee40.fact: France, officially the French Republic, is a country primarily located in Western Europe.

6cf2195c4f7f.fact: Its 18 integral regions—five of which are overseas—span a combined area of 632,702 km2 (244,288 sq mi), with a total population estimated at 69.1 million in 2026.

de33d1974d6b.key: Its capital, largest city and main cultural and ec
de33d1974d6b.fact: Its capital, largest city and main cultural and economic centre is Paris.

bc98bdaa5ca4.key: Metropolitan France was settled during the Iron Ag
bc98bdaa5ca4.fact: Metropolitan France was settled during the Iron Age by Celtic tribes known as Gauls before Rome annexed the area in 51 BC, leading to a distinct Gallo-Roman culture.

aec19370dc59.key: France was plunged into a dynastic conflict with E
aec19370dc59.fact: In the High Middle Ages, France was a powerful but decentralised feudal kingdom, but from the mid-14th to the mid-15th centuries, France was plunged into a dynastic conflict with England known as the Hundred Years' War.

52eac916ea5a.fact: Internally, France was dominated by the conflict with the House of Habsburg and the French Wars of Religion between Catholics and Huguenots.

e165d4f2174b.fact: France was one of the major participants of World War I, from which it emerged victorious at great human and economic cost.

28603acd0527.key: Its collapse initiated a period of relative declin
28603acd0527.fact: Its collapse initiated a period of relative decline in which France endured the Bourbon Restoration until the founding of the French Second Republic which was succeeded by the Second French Empire upon Napoleon III's takeover.

51164f47f362.key: and a period of economic prosperity and cultural a
51164f47f362.fact: This led to the establishment of the French Third Republic, and a period of economic prosperity and cultural and scientific flourishing known as the Belle Époque.

7d6983e2047d.fact: Following its liberation in 1944, the short-lived Fourth Republic was established and later dissolved over the course of the Algerian War.

5ad35beedb09.fact: The current Fifth Republic, a semi-presidential system, was formed in 1958 by Charles de Gaulle.

3d19a4604271.key: It hosts the fourth-largest number of UNESCO World
3d19a4604271.fact: It hosts the fourth-largest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites and is the world's leading tourist destination, having received over 100 million foreign visitors in 2024.

3c75323e7cf0.fact: Quantum mechanics is the fundamental physical theory that describes the behavior of matter and of light; its unusual characteristics typically occur at and below the scale of atoms.

74e36c5944ce.key: Classical physics can describe many aspects of nat
74e36c5944ce.fact: Classical physics can describe many aspects of nature at an ordinary (macroscopic and (optical) microscopic) scale, but is not sufficient for describing them at very small submicroscopic (atomic and subatomic) scales.

2b9ba8572ce5.key: Classical mechanics can be derived from quantum me
2b9ba8572ce5.fact: Classical mechanics can be derived from quantum mechanics as an approximation that is valid at ordinary scales.

c85ff33f9bca.key: Quantum systems have bound states that
c85ff33f9bca.fact: Quantum systems have bound states that are quantized to discrete values of energy, momentum, angular momentum, and other quantities, in contrast to classical systems where these quantities can be measured continuously.

bf7aba9a1e70.key: Measurements of quantum systems show characteristi
bf7aba9a1e70.fact: Measurements of quantum systems show characteristics of both particles and waves (wave–particle duality), and there are limits to how accurately the value of a physical quantity can be predicted prior to its measurement, given a complete set of initial conditions (the uncertainty principle).

3ec67aa5c1b5.fact: Quantum mechanics arose gradually from theories to explain observations that could not be reconciled with classical physics, such as Max Planck's solution in 1900 to the black-body radiation problem, and the correspondence between energy and frequency in Albert Einstein's 1905 paper, which explained the photoelectric effect.

97bc592b27a9.fact: These early attempts to understand microscopic phenomena, now known as the "old quantum theory", led to the full development of quantum mechanics in the mid-1920s by Niels Bohr, Erwin Schrödinger, Werner Heisenberg, Max Born, Paul Dirac and others.

aded881352b8.fact: The modern theory is formulated in various specially developed mathematical formalisms.

44ad044c9bdd.fact: Douglas Stone is the Carl Morse Professor of Applied Physics and Physics at Yale University.

6f96cfdfe5cc.fact: He was co-author of a three-volume treatise, Foundations of Measurement.

3c34280245ee.fact: He was a Rhodes Scholar in 1976, An Alfred P.

de6838252f95.fact: Salam was scientific advisor to the Ministry of Science and Technology in Pakistan from 1960 to 1974, a position from which he played a major and influential role in the development of the country's science infrastructure.

c095c5abcc42.fact: For this, he is viewed as the "scientific father" of this program.

05145c56f01e.fact: In 1974, Abdus Salam departed from his country in protest after the Parliament of Pakistan unanimously passed a parliamentary bill declaring members of the Ahmadiyya Muslim community, to which Salam belonged, non-Muslim.

036fcda590c2.key: As a teacher and science promoter, Salam
036fcda590c2.fact: As a teacher and science promoter, Salam is remembered as a founder and scientific father of mathematical and theoretical physics in Pakistan during his term as the chief scientific advisor to the president.

c4e9be3b2a2d.fact: 20 March] 1727) was an English polymath who was a mathematician, physicist, astronomer, alchemist, theologian, author and inventor.

038a8781480d.fact: His book Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica (Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy), first published in 1687, achieved the first great unification in physics and established classical mechanics.

3d0359869cee.key: Newton contributed to and refined the scientific m
3d0359869cee.fact: Newton contributed to and refined the scientific method, and his work is considered the most influential in bringing forth modern science.

b054257f2941.key: In the Principia, Newton formulated the laws of mo
b054257f2941.fact: In the Principia, Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation that formed the dominant scientific viewpoint for centuries until it was superseded by the theory of relativity.

7175ebdc6ef7.fact: While this is the case, his laws still serve as excellent approximations for the vast majority of physical phenomena involving low speeds (much less than the speed of light) and weak gravitational fields.

c2949401674e.fact: Newton's inference that the Earth is an oblate spheroid was later confirmed by the geodetic measurements of Alexis Clairaut, Charles Marie de La Condamine, and others, convincing most European scientists of the superiority of Newtonian mechanics over earlier systems.

f003f22517ca.fact: Further, he was the first to provide a quantitative estimate of the solar mass.

dfd2c2ff84ee.fact: His work on light was collected in his book Opticks, published in 1704.

c90c0b486057.key: He anticipated the wave–particle duality of light
c90c0b486057.fact: He anticipated the wave–particle duality of light and was first to theorise the Goos–Hänchen effect.

f89db93aba4c.key: He also formulated an empirical law of cooling, wh
f89db93aba4c.fact: He also formulated an empirical law of cooling, which was the first heat transfer formulation and serves as the formal basis of convective heat transfer, made the first theoretical calculation of the speed of sound, and introduced the notions of a Newtonian fluid and a black body.

8b2546a973b8.fact: Moreover, he was the first to analyse Couette flow.

613620c3976c.key: In addition to his creation of calculus, Newton's
613620c3976c.fact: In addition to his creation of calculus, Newton's work on mathematics was extensive.

5f62d67a9791.key: He generalised the binomial theorem to any real nu
5f62d67a9791.fact: He generalised the binomial theorem to any real number, introduced the Puiseux series, was the first to state Bézout's theorem, classified most of the cubic plane curves, contributed to the study of Cremona transformations, developed a method for approximating the roots of a function, originated the Newton–Cotes formulas used for numerical integration, and further produced the earliest explicit enunciation of the general Taylor series.

207a65dca8f7.key: Additionally, Newton initiated the field of calcul
207a65dca8f7.fact: Additionally, Newton initiated the field of calculus of variations, formulated and solved the earliest problem in geometric probability, devised the earliest form of linear regression, and was a pioneer of vector analysis.

da6fa909f1c0.fact: Newton was a fellow of Trinity College and the second Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at the University of Cambridge; he was appointed at the age of 26.

95450693e33b.fact: He was knighted by Queen Anne in 1705 and spent the last three decades of his life in London, serving as Warden (1696–1699) and Master (1699–1727) of the Royal Mint, in which he increased the accuracy and security of British coinage.

ca78d06d364b.key: Due to the uncertain loyalty of a group of 'modera

caabaaa852b1.fact: An Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com and its partners for product identification within the Amazon organization.

62736db673d3.fact: They were designed in 1996 by Rebecca Allen, an Amazon software engineer, when it became clear that Amazon was going to sell products other than just books.

9368e0f15fd5.fact: The 10-character format of the ASIN was adopted so that Amazon databases and software, which were designed to expect a 10-character International Standard Book Number (ISBN) field, would not have to be changed to accommodate the new identification format.

f20ede7ddbeb.key: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Know
f20ede7ddbeb.fact: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge (commonly called the Principles of Human Knowledge, or simply the Treatise) is a 1710 work, in English, by Irish Empiricist philosopher George Berkeley.
f20ede7ddbeb.source: Wikipedia: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge

3a970087b828.key: Whilst, like all the Empiricist philosophers, both
3a970087b828.fact: Whilst, like all the Empiricist philosophers, both Locke and Berkeley agreed that we are having experiences, regardless of whether material objects exist, Berkeley sought to prove that the outside world (the world which causes the ideas one has within one's mind) is also composed solely of ideas.
3a970087b828.source: Wikipedia: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge

26e6d2460741.fact: This world is (or, at least, was) given logic and regularity by some other force, which Berkeley concludes is God.
26e6d2460741.source: Wikipedia: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge

a69d6b72e78d.key: A priori ('from the earlier') and a posteriori ('f
a69d6b72e78d.fact: A priori ('from the earlier') and a posteriori ('from the later') are Latin phrases used in philosophy & linguistics to distinguish types of knowledge, justification, or argument by their reliance on experience.
a69d6b72e78d.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

4b23b3ddfc8f.fact: A priori knowledge is independent of any experience.
4b23b3ddfc8f.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

04accb719642.fact: Prior analytics (a priori) is about deductive logic, which comes from definitions and first principles.
04accb719642.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

bf4a4906aea4.fact: Posterior analytics (a posteriori) is about inductive logic, which comes from observational evidence.
bf4a4906aea4.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

85382124ab86.key: Both terms appear in Euclid's Elements and
85382124ab86.fact: Both terms appear in Euclid's Elements and were popularized by Immanuel Kant's Critique of Pure Reason, an influential work in the history of philosophy.
85382124ab86.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

fec5ae8b633c.fact: Both terms are primarily used as modifiers to the noun "knowledge" (e.g., "a priori knowledge").
fec5ae8b633c.source: Wikipedia: A priori and a posteriori

2ebba01181e8.fact: He moved to England at a young age due to the religious persecution of Huguenots in France which reached a climax in 1685 with the Edict of Fontainebleau.

7f9996722dd5.key: Among his fellow Huguenot exiles in England, he
7f9996722dd5.fact: Among his fellow Huguenot exiles in England, he was a colleague of the editor and translator Pierre des Maizeaux.

828e4783f168.fact: He also was the first to postulate the central limit theorem, a cornerstone of probability theory, of which he proved a special case.

8637ecd42d69.fact: Abraham de la Pryme (15 January 1671 – 12 June 1704) was an English antiquary.

5e66253f89dc.fact: While there is no universally accepted definition, common examples illustrate the difference: numbers, sets, and ideas are typically classified as abstract objects, whereas plants, dogs, and planets are considered concrete objects.

ede736ed7054.key: Metaphysical relation – In metaphysics, concrete o
ede736ed7054.fact: Metaphysical relation – In metaphysics, concrete objects are specific, individual things (particulars), while abstract objects represent general concepts or categories (universals).

f5c118c8ea8c.fact: Another view is that it is the distinction between contingent existence versus necessary existence; however, philosophers differ on which type of existence here defines abstractness, as opposed to concreteness.

e3dbd3252d04.key: Despite this diversity of views, there
e3dbd3252d04.fact: Despite this diversity of views, there is broad agreement concerning most objects as to whether they are abstract or concrete, such that most interpretations agree, for example, that rocks are concrete objects while numbers are abstract objects.

518033c2f15e.fact: Abstract objects are most commonly used in philosophy, particularly metaphysics, and semantics.

2bb3d86d9523.fact: They were first described by institutional economists Gardiner Means and Adolf A.

2888221951d3.fact: The term abstract object is said to have been coined by Willard Van Orman Quine.

28368fd5fa8c.fact: Abstract object theory is a discipline that studies the nature and role of abstract objects.

7f54d5f49f5b.fact: This approach is also known as the dual copula strategy.

cb8859275a7a.fact: Abstract object theory (AOT) is a branch of metaphysics regarding abstract objects.

4a3550e308d0.fact: Originally devised by metaphysician Edward Zalta in 1981, the theory was an expansion of mathematical Platonism.

e8136f19f592.key: However, the religio-philosophical aspects of his
e8136f19f592.fact: However, the religio-philosophical aspects of his thought, which also included a belief in five "eternal principles", are fragmentary and only reported by authors who were often hostile to him.

887dc8f1df13.key: A comprehensive thinker, al-Razi made fundamental
887dc8f1df13.fact: A comprehensive thinker, al-Razi made fundamental and enduring contributions to various fields, which he recorded in over 200 manuscripts, and is particularly remembered for numerous advances in medicine through his observations and discoveries.

5f7b7d4aab06.key: As a teacher of medicine, he attracted students of
5f7b7d4aab06.fact: As a teacher of medicine, he attracted students of all backgrounds and interests and was said to be compassionate and devoted to the service of his patients, whether rich or poor.

99145bf09d89.key: Along with Thābit ibn Qurra (836–901), he
99145bf09d89.fact: Along with Thābit ibn Qurra (836–901), he was one of the first to clinically distinguish between smallpox and measles.

e5a6b0d8d05f.key: She shared the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics with he
e5a6b0d8d05f.fact: She shared the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics with her husband Pierre Curie "for their joint researches on the radioactivity phenomena discovered by Professor Henri Becquerel".

9eb0d040ef57.fact: She is an expert in using tools from behavioral economics to influence parenting behavior.

5a07504fca31.fact: Marie and Pierre were first married couple to win the Nobel Prize and launching the Curie family legacy of five Nobel Prizes.

3d8c60a72150.fact: She was, in 1906, the first woman to become a professor at the University of Paris.

701a1d973e93.fact: She was born in Warsaw, in what was then the Kingdom of Poland, part of the Russian Empire.

f249ca89f6cf.fact: In 1891, aged 24, she followed her elder sister Bronisława to study in Paris, where she earned her higher degrees and conducted her subsequent scientific work.

5854402550a2.fact: She named the first chemical element she and Pierre discovered polonium, after her native country.

448ce227216b.fact: Deoxyribonucleic acid (; DNA) is a polymer composed of two polynucleotide chains that coil around each other to form a double helix.

47c27afafc0a.fact: DNA and ribonucleic acid (RNA) are nucleic acids.

b335492b92ab.key: Alongside proteins, lipids and complex carbohydrat
b335492b92ab.fact: Alongside proteins, lipids and complex carbohydrates (polysaccharides), nucleic acids are one of the four major types of macromolecules that are essential for all known forms of life.

04ec456f66c8.fact: The two DNA strands are known as polynucleotides as they are composed of simpler monomeric units called nucleotides.

6c994a57390d.fact: Each nucleotide is composed of one of four nitrogen-containing nucleobases (cytosine [C], guanine [G], adenine [A] or thymine [T]), a sugar called deoxyribose, and a phosphate group.

02b87c38dda9.fact: The nucleotides are joined to one another in a chain by covalent bonds (known as the phosphodiester linkage) between the sugar of one nucleotide and the phosphate of the next, resulting in an alternating sugar-phosphate backbone.

452b65bfaf8d.key: The nitrogenous bases of the two separate polynucl
452b65bfaf8d.fact: The nitrogenous bases of the two separate polynucleotide strands are bound together, according to base pairing rules (A with T and C with G), with hydrogen bonds to make double-stranded DNA.

38df0baf2d48.fact: The complementary nitrogenous bases are divided into two groups, the single-ringed pyrimidines and the double-ringed purines.

9193ac0ab095.fact: In DNA, the pyrimidines are thymine and cytosine; the purines are adenine and guanine.

5a51cc19d780.fact: This information is replicated when the two strands separate.

fa5bdf432219.key: The two strands of DNA run in opposite directions
fa5bdf432219.fact: The two strands of DNA run in opposite directions to each other and are thus antiparallel.

e77ef9f3d6e7.fact: Attached to each sugar is one of four types of nucleobases (or bases).

0f4442be6635.fact: RNA strands are created using DNA strands as a template in a process called transcription, where DNA bases are exchanged for their corresponding bases except in the case of thymine (T), for which RNA substitutes uracil (U).

99a42be46383.fact: Within eukaryotic cells, DNA is organized into long structures called chromosomes.

4f3ee6839cd2.key: Before typical cell division, these chromosomes
4f3ee6839cd2.fact: Before typical cell division, these chromosomes are duplicated in the process of DNA replication, providing a complete set of chromosomes for each daughter cell.

843dd65c5c8c.key: These compacting structures guide the interactions
843dd65c5c8c.fact: These compacting structures guide the interactions between DNA and other proteins, helping control which parts of the DNA are transcribed.

42e30676c629.fact: 5-Methylcytosine (5mC, m5C) is a methylated form of the DNA base cytosine (C) that regulates gene transcription and takes several other biological roles.

3581c7396a80.fact: When cytosine is methylated, the DNA maintains the same sequence, but the expression of methylated genes can be altered (the study of this is part of the field of epigenetics).

5dd6c21ee350.fact: 5-Hydroxymethylcytosine (5hmC) is a DNA pyrimidine nitrogen base derived from cytosine.

a0ee8a9d7e3e.fact: However, in 2009 it was found to be abundant in human and mouse brains, as well as in embryonic stem cells.

1d0601457619.fact: The Solar System is within the heliosphere constantly flooded by the charged plasma particles of the solar wind, which forms with the interplanetary dust, gas and cosmic rays between the bodies of the Solar System an interplanetary medium.

7e912f77e3a9.fact: Inside the Sun's core hydrogen is fused into helium for billions of years, releasing energy which is over even longer periods of time emitted through the Sun's outer layer, the photosphere.

6f9b2892ddd6.key: The mass of the Solar System
6f9b2892ddd6.fact: The mass of the Solar System is by 99.86% almost completely made up of the Sun's mass.

63afcbfe675c.key: The next most massive objects of the system
63afcbfe675c.fact: The next most massive objects of the system are the eight planets, which by definition dominate the orbits they occupy.

26fc01c39485.key: Closest to the Sun in order of increasing distance
26fc01c39485.fact: Closest to the Sun in order of increasing distance are the four terrestrial planets – Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

bd4c4ea1b44a.fact: These were largely supplanted by raster-based devices in the following decades.

3d5289e37027.fact: Earth and Mars are the only planets in the Solar System which orbit within the Sun's habitable zone, in which the sunlight can make surface water under atmospheric pressure liquid.

49103e22d42e.key: Beyond the frost line at about five astronomical u
49103e22d42e.fact: Beyond the frost line at about five astronomical units (AU), are two gas giants – Jupiter and Saturn – and two ice giants – Uranus and Neptune.

f90927c884ca.fact: Additionally to the planets there are in the Solar System other planetary-mass objects, but which do not dominate their orbits, such as dwarf planets and planetary-mass moons.

e96225238b02.fact: Four other Solar System objects are generally identified as such: Orcus, Quaoar, Gonggong, and Sedna.

a0ddf3321431.fact: Natural satellites, which are commonly called 'moons', can be found throughout the Solar System and in sizes from planetary-mass moons to much less massive moonlets at their smallest.

0fc492013be7.key: The largest two moons (Ganymede of Jupiter and Tit
0fc492013be7.fact: The largest two moons (Ganymede of Jupiter and Titan of Saturn) are larger than the smallest planet (Mercury), while the seven most massive, which includes Earth's Moon, are more massive and larger than any of the dwarf planets.

b2ce4f82df6d.key: Less massive than these planetary-mass objects
b2ce4f82df6d.fact: Less massive than these planetary-mass objects are the vast number of small Solar System bodies, such as asteroids, comets, centaurs, meteoroids, and interplanetary dust clouds.

c2eca1dfce2a.key: All dwarf planets and many of the smaller bodies
c2eca1dfce2a.fact: All dwarf planets and many of the smaller bodies are within the asteroid belt (between Mars's and Jupiter's orbit) and the Kuiper belt (just outside Neptune's orbit).

5fca5e971811.key: At around 70–90 AU from the Sun, the solar wind
5fca5e971811.fact: At around 70–90 AU from the Sun, the solar wind is halted by the interstellar medium, resulting in the heliopause and the border of the interplanetary medium to interstellar space.

6929d88f47d2.key: The closest star to the Solar System, Proxima Cent
6929d88f47d2.fact: The closest star to the Solar System, Proxima Centauri, is 269,000 AU (4.25 ly) away.

f6cb3e816496.fact: Both are within the Local Bubble, a relatively small 1,000 light-years (ly) wide region of the Milky Way.

77022bb43eaf.fact: 10199 Chariklo is a ringed asteroid or centaur in the outer Solar System.

20c93fb9534d.fact: It was created in 1987 by Thomas and John Knoll.

7ece713deb57.fact: Chariklo has a dark, reddish surface composed of water ice, silicate minerals, amorphous carbon, and various complex organic compounds (also known as tholins).

6c7847e46f8d.fact: The rings of Chariklo were discovered in 2013, when astronomers observed Chariklo occulting or passing in front of a star.

d5ec1e3c4208.key: Chariklo was the first minor planet
d5ec1e3c4208.fact: Chariklo was the first minor planet discovered to have rings, and as of 2025, it is one of the four minor planets known to have rings (the three others being 2060 Chiron, Haumea, and Quaoar).

dce689a03ddc.fact: The origin of Chariklo's rings is uncertain, with various possible explanations including ejection of surface material via outgassing or tidal disruption of a moon around Chariklo.

3ab3978dfe09.fact: 10 Hygiea is a large asteroid located in the outer main asteroid belt between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.

8915904b2fe9.key: It was the tenth known asteroid,
8915904b2fe9.fact: It was the tenth known asteroid, discovered on 12 April 1849 by Italian astronomer Annibale de Gasparis at the Astronomical Observatory of Capodimonte in Naples, Italy.

d53889615949.fact: Hygiea is the parent body of the Hygiea family, an asteroid family comprising over 7,000 known asteroids that share similar orbital and compositional characteristics with Hygiea.

bcb6580b1801.fact: The Hygiea family is believed to have formed by a giant impact on Hygiea about 2 to 3 billion years ago.

7ec17bb36e12.fact: This impact is thought to have shattered Hygiea, which led to its reaccumulation as a nearly spherical body.

20bf7bcdc63e.fact: Salacia (minor-planet designation: 120347 Salacia) is a large trans-Neptunian object (TNO) and possible dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt that is probably between 800 km (500 mi) and 875 km (544 mi) in diameter.

850edf0f6fc7.key: Salacia orbits the Sun at an average distance that
850edf0f6fc7.fact: Salacia orbits the Sun at an average distance that is slightly greater than that of Pluto.

a174277eedc1.key: Salacia and Actaea form a binary system where both
a174277eedc1.fact: Salacia and Actaea form a binary system where both bodies are tidally locked to the other, similar to Pluto and Charon.

fc6a2955f2bb.key: The modern-day rise in global temperatures
fc6a2955f2bb.fact: The modern-day rise in global temperatures is driven by human activities, especially fossil fuel (coal, oil and natural gas) burning since the Industrial Revolution.

c89334d7f1b7.fact: Deserts are expanding, while heat waves and wildfires are becoming more common.

81c20bcb2b04.fact: Higher temperatures are also causing more intense storms, droughts, and other weather extremes.

d874e53a06d3.key: Rapid environmental change in mountains, coral ree
d874e53a06d3.fact: Rapid environmental change in mountains, coral reefs, and the Arctic is forcing many species to relocate or become extinct.

74b8446b9f59.key: Even if efforts to minimize future warming
74b8446b9f59.fact: Even if efforts to minimize future warming are successful, some effects will continue for centuries.

23fd7eea8d4e.fact: Poorer communities are responsible for a small share of global emissions, yet have the least ability to adapt and are most vulnerable to climate change.

d850f04cdb48.fact: There are a variety of approaches including not only empirical estimation using econometrics, input-output analysis or simulations but also case studies, historical analogy and so-called common sense or the "vernacular".

44eb7924ff6a.fact: The 2019–20 Australian bushfire season, also known as the Black Summer, was one of the most intense and catastrophic fire seasons on record in Australia.

48cfeaa368d2.fact: Bushfire smoke was responsible for an additional 417 deaths.

40ceaef32b62.key: An estimated three billion terrestrial vertebrates
40ceaef32b62.fact: An estimated three billion terrestrial vertebrates, mostly reptiles, were killed or displaced.

49e1b759bff9.fact: Rescue and recovery efforts were immense.

c2c58180b957.fact: States of emergency were declared across various regions of New South Wales (NSW) and the north-east to east of Victoria, which were the areas most impacted.

54732b5bcd33.fact: The Australian Defence Force was mobilised to provide manpower and logistical support, and international crews were brought in from New Zealand, Singapore, Canada and the United States.

fb72a3f86930.key: The last major fire in Victoria
fb72a3f86930.fact: The last major fire in Victoria was contained on 27 February 2020, and all fires in New South Wales were extinguished by 2 March.

34d9b0202e67.fact: The total economic loss was estimated being at least $100 billion, far and away the costliest natural disaster in Australian history.

dfbac708183d.fact: An estimated $500 million was donated by the public, international organisations, public figures and celebrities for victim relief and wildlife recovery.

937fdaf74a1c.key: Convoys of donated food, clothing and livestock fe
937fdaf74a1c.fact: Convoys of donated food, clothing and livestock feed were sent to affected areas.

cc4788a19a52.fact: Machine learning (ML) is a field of study in artificial intelligence concerned with the development and study of statistical algorithms that can learn from data and generalize to unseen data, and thus perform tasks without explicit instructions.

b7e43a0346e4.key: The application of ML to business problems is
b7e43a0346e4.fact: The application of ML to business problems is known as predictive analytics.

dea0a476bf52.fact: Data mining is a related field of study, focusing on exploratory data analysis (EDA) through unsupervised learning.

4921c0e2d1f6.fact: 15.ai is a free non-commercial web application and research project that uses artificial intelligence to generate text-to-speech voices of fictional characters from popular media.

ed610372b26b.key: Created by a pseudonymous artificial intelligence
ed610372b26b.fact: Created by a pseudonymous artificial intelligence researcher known as 15, who began developing the technology as a freshman during their undergraduate research at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), the application allows users to make characters from video games, television shows, and movies speak custom text with emotional inflections.

5869c882f73a.fact: The platform is able to generate convincing voice output using minimal training data; the name "15.ai" references the creator's statement that a voice can be cloned with just 15 seconds of audio.

34e9e7fc58f5.key: ai became an Internet phenomenon in early 2021 whe
34e9e7fc58f5.fact: Launched in March 2020, 15.ai became an Internet phenomenon in early 2021 when content utilizing it went viral on social media and quickly gained widespread use among Internet fandoms, such as the My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, Team Fortress 2, and SpongeBob SquarePants fandoms.

545d94d74ea3.fact: In January 2022, it was discovered that a company called Voiceverse had generated voice lines using 15.ai without attribution, promoted them as the byproduct of their own technology, and sold them as non-fungible tokens (NFT) without permission.

2ddb3587cc07.fact: Its shutdown was followed by the emergence of commercial alternatives whose founders have acknowledged 15.ai's pioneering influence in the field of deep learning speech synthesis.

e2155324d06d.fact: Created in the first group of Internet domains in March of 1985, its name is derived from the word commercial, indicating its original intended purpose for subdomains registered by commercial organizations.

a3bc7b8f50eb.key: China, officially the People's Republic of China (
a3bc7b8f50eb.fact: China, officially the People's Republic of China (PRC), is a country in East Asia.

fe031ce9efba.fact: The country is divided into 33 province-level divisions: 22 provinces, 5 autonomous regions, 4 municipalities, and 2 semi-autonomous special administrative regions.

0420a206ae8b.fact: Beijing is the capital, while Shanghai is the most populous city by urban area and largest financial center.

9808663259b4.fact: In 221 BCE, China was unified under an emperor, ushering in two millennia of imperial rule.

8433476bf76f.key: The 1911 Revolution overthrew the Qing dynasty and
8433476bf76f.fact: The 1911 Revolution overthrew the Qing dynasty and the Republic of China was established the following year.

373d3eae1b5c.fact: The Chinese Civil War began in 1927, when Kuomintang forces purged members of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).

e6a4ea193743.fact: China was invaded by the Empire of Japan in 1937, leading the CCP and Kuomintang to form the Second United Front to fight the Japanese.

08e9f8901d7a.fact: In 1949, the CCP proclaimed the People's Republic of China and forced the Kuomintang-led government to retreat to the island of Taiwan.

456c0b596154.key: Following the implementation of land reforms, atte
456c0b596154.fact: Following the implementation of land reforms, attempts by the CCP to realize communism failed: the Great Leap Forward was responsible for the Great Chinese Famine which resulted in millions of deaths, and the Cultural Revolution was a period of turmoil and persecution.

dedc8da1d7c0.fact: The reform and opening up that began in 1978 moved the country away from a planned economy towards a market-based economy, spurring an economic boom.

16aa46bd354e.key: Making up around one-fifth of the world's economy,
16aa46bd354e.fact: Making up around one-fifth of the world's economy, China is the second-wealthiest country in the world, with the Chinese economy being the largest when adjusted for PPP.

b344f8ef3eea.key: China has been one of the fastest-growing modern e
b344f8ef3eea.fact: China has been one of the fastest-growing modern economies and is the world's largest manufacturer and exporter, as well as the second-largest importer.

8a7d7ba288ca.fact: China is known for its cuisine and culture.

4ed29321d7b3.fact: Telephone numbers in Hong Kong are mostly eight-digit.

637ebca61838.key: The telephone number for emergency services – Poli
637ebca61838.fact: The telephone number for emergency services – Police, Fire Service and Ambulance – is 999 for all telephone lines.

c90ad593115d.key: These numbers can also be used for mobile and othe
c90ad593115d.fact: These numbers can also be used for mobile and other users: 992 – fax on fixed line, SMS on mobile phones (for subscribers with disabilities) 112 – mobile phones Some special numbers are three- to five-digit.

6b62eb28a2ba.key: Some premium rate services, for example for games
6b62eb28a2ba.fact: Some premium rate services, for example for games and adult contents, are 11-digit.

7231cecf46ae.fact: Numbers beginning with '1' are usually reserved for carrier/operator services.

d17e5b095881.fact: These services are provided by the individual telephone carrier.

ae1b958e8b71.key: In general, these numbers can be used across all c
ae1b958e8b71.fact: In general, these numbers can be used across all carriers: Directory services – 1081 (English), 1083 (Cantonese) and 1088 (Mandarin) Time and temperature information – 18501 (English), 18503 (Cantonese) and 18508 (Mandarin) The international call prefix varies depending on IDD provider, however 001 works on all phone lines and uses the IDD service provided by the same carrier as the telephone line that 001 call is dialed from.

f5f9fe6ef434.key: During the years of telephone monopoly, the Intern
f5f9fe6ef434.fact: During the years of telephone monopoly, the International call prefix was 106 (through 1980s) and then 001.

39f86e69915d.key: Calls from Hong Kong to Macau and mainland China
39f86e69915d.fact: Calls from Hong Kong to Macau and mainland China are international, and include that regions' country code: Macau +853 xxxx xxxx Mainland China +86 (area code) xxxx xxxx

0a304f17ad42.fact: In addition to 999, two more emergency hotline numbers 110 (mainly for tourists from mainland China) and 112 (mainly for tourists from overseas) can be dialed, however calls made to 110 and 112 are redirected to the 999 call centre.

9abac16dbe4b.fact: With a population of almost 123 million as of 2026, it is the world's 11th most populous country.

ef0cc10ff462.fact: Tokyo is the country's capital and largest city.

5833aca4ad93.key: Between the 4th and 6th centuries, its kingdoms
5833aca4ad93.fact: Between the 4th and 6th centuries, its kingdoms were united under an emperor in Nara and later in Heian-kyō.

7ff254cb5c03.key: actual power was held by military aristocrats

4cb2de154a08.fact: After rule by the Kamakura and Ashikaga shogunates and a century of warring states, Japan was unified in 1600 by the Tokugawa shogunate, which implemented an isolationist foreign policy.

bba49031b777.fact: In 1853, an American fleet forced Japan to open trade to the West, which led to the end of the shogunate and the restoration of imperial power in 1868.

8b9cdf133ee5.fact: Japan is a constitutional monarchy with a bicameral legislature known as the National Diet.

c9b8ae4f4d57.key: A developed country with one of the world's larges
c9b8ae4f4d57.fact: A developed country with one of the world's largest economies by nominal GDP, it is a global leader in the automotive, electronics, and robotics industries, in addition to making significant contributions to science and technology.

e33e7a717f2e.key: It has one of the world's highest life expectancie
e33e7a717f2e.fact: It has one of the world's highest life expectancies, but is undergoing a population decline.

6f33a217eb3a.fact: It was established in 1986 and is administered by the Japan Registry Services.

a6f5d9c12741.fact: The nation's capital and most populous city is Berlin and its main financial centre is Frankfurt; the largest urban area is the Ruhr.

f07fc070bd4f.fact: After World War I and a revolution, the Empire was replaced by the Weimar Republic.

10a25ad4b620.key: As a major force in several industrial, scientific
10a25ad4b620.fact: As a major force in several industrial, scientific and technological sectors, Germany is both the world's third-largest exporter and third-largest importer.

3c4cbe485412.fact: Widely considered a great power, Germany is part of multiple international organisations and forums.

8d2ea5d72093.fact: It has the third-highest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites: 55, of which 52 are cultural.

6ae28a55456b.fact: Mathematics is a field of study that discovers and organizes methods, theories, and theorems that are developed and proved for the needs of empirical sciences and mathematics itself.

40230032127f.key: Mathematics involves the description and manipulat
40230032127f.fact: Mathematics involves the description and manipulation of abstract objects that consist of either abstractions from nature or—in modern mathematics—purely abstract entities that are stipulated to have certain properties, called axioms.

d98d39b55c24.key: These results, called theorems, include previously
d98d39b55c24.fact: These results, called theorems, include previously proved theorems, axioms, and—in case of abstraction from nature—some basic properties that are considered true starting points of the theory under consideration.

c3a50cdab808.fact: Although mathematics is extensively used for modeling phenomena, the fundamental truths of mathematics are independent of any scientific experimentation.

1c6bab39ffa6.key: Some areas of mathematics, such as statistics and
1c6bab39ffa6.fact: Some areas of mathematics, such as statistics and game theory, are developed in close correlation with their applications and are often grouped under applied mathematics.

c37ebbd384c0.fact: Other areas are developed independently from any application (and are therefore called pure mathematics) but often later find practical applications.

b4da5a1ec841.fact: Since its beginning, mathematics was primarily divided into geometry and arithmetics (the manipulation of natural numbers and fractions) until the 16th and 17th centuries, when algebra and infinitesimal calculus were introduced as new fields.

74581aaf78dd.fact: A Mathematician's Apology is a 1940 essay by British mathematician G.

fc3929e84c70.key: Central to Hardy's "apology" – in the sense of a f
fc3929e84c70.fact: Central to Hardy's "apology" – in the sense of a formal justification or defence (as in Plato's Apology of Socrates) – is an argument that mathematics has value independent of its applications.

00f5c7c3c0af.key: The Abel Prize ( AH-bəl; Norwegian: Abelprisen [ˈɑ
00f5c7c3c0af.fact: The Abel Prize ( AH-bəl; Norwegian: Abelprisen [ˈɑ̀ːbl̩ˌpriːsn̩]) is awarded annually by the King of Norway to one or more outstanding mathematicians.

7f5b948eb6ef.key: The Abel Prize's history dates back to 1899, when
7f5b948eb6ef.fact: The Abel Prize's history dates back to 1899, when its establishment was proposed by the Norwegian mathematician Sophus Lie when he learned that Alfred Nobel's plans for annual prizes would not include a prize in mathematics.

6f9daaf8eb71.fact: In 1902, King Oscar II of Sweden and Norway indicated his willingness to finance the creation of a mathematics prize to complement the Nobel Prizes, but the establishment of the prize was prevented by the dissolution of the union between Norway and Sweden in 1905.

fb090375ca56.fact: It took almost a century before the prize was finally established by the Government of Norway in 2001, and it was specifically intended "to give the mathematicians their own equivalent of a Nobel Prize." The laureates are selected by the Abel Committee, the members of whom are appointed by the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters.

34bda69f3f5f.key: The award ceremony takes place in the aula of the
34bda69f3f5f.fact: The award ceremony takes place in the aula of the University of Oslo, where the Nobel Peace Prize was awarded between 1947 and 1989.

8cfb10d3dd0a.fact: Physics is the scientific study of matter, its fundamental constituents, its motion and behavior through space and time, and the related entities of energy and force.

52a1b1128651.key: A scientist who specializes in the field of physic
52a1b1128651.fact: A scientist who specializes in the field of physics is called a physicist.

23e9f11a27a2.key: Over much of the past two millennia, physics, chem
23e9f11a27a2.fact: Over much of the past two millennia, physics, chemistry, biology, and certain branches of mathematics were a part of natural philosophy, but during the Scientific Revolution in the 17th century, these natural sciences branched into separate research endeavors.

6025df02e809.key: Physics intersects with many interdisciplinary are
6025df02e809.fact: Physics intersects with many interdisciplinary areas of research, such as biophysics and quantum chemistry, and the boundaries of physics are not rigidly defined.

b50b8ea1b438.fact: A Greek–English Lexicon, often referred to as Liddell & Scott () or Liddell–Scott–Jones (LSJ), is a standard lexicographical work of the Ancient Greek language originally edited by Henry George Liddell, Robert Scott, Henry Stuart Jones, and Roderick McKenzie and published in 1843 by the Oxford University Press.

3c575fe4b6c0.fact: Biology is the scientific study of life and living organisms.

85d18b690bc5.fact: Central to biology are five fundamental themes: the cell as the basic unit of life, genes and heredity as the basis of inheritance, evolution as the driver of biological diversity, energy transformation for sustaining life processes, and the maintenance of internal stability (homeostasis).

d3b3822be32d.fact: Modern biology is grounded in the theory of evolution by natural selection, first articulated by Charles Darwin, and in the molecular understanding of genes encoded in DNA.

dcda5b6691b0.fact: Life on Earth is believed to have originated over 3.7 billion years ago.

5f3e8dcaab2c.fact: ATP synthase is a molecular machine.

356743c12fd5.fact: This electrochemical gradient is generated by the electron transport chain and allows cells to store energy in ATP for later use.

6a475f5161da.key: Organisms capable of photosynthesis also have ATP
6a475f5161da.fact: Organisms capable of photosynthesis also have ATP synthase across the thylakoid membrane, which in plants is located in the chloroplast and in cyanobacteria is located in the cytoplasm.

d3a6d2c4efd0.fact: Eukaryotic ATP synthases are F-ATPases (which usually work as ATP synthases instead of ATPases in cellular environments) and running "in reverse" for an ATPase (ATPases catalyze the decomposition of ATP into ADP and a free phosphate ion).

dce09f281c35.fact: Chemistry is the scientific study of the properties and behavior of matter.

3f0f6a5a4f50.key: For example, chemistry explains aspects of plant g
3f0f6a5a4f50.fact: For example, chemistry explains aspects of plant growth (botany), the formation of igneous rocks (geology), how atmospheric ozone is formed and how environmental pollutants are degraded (ecology), the properties of the soil on the Moon (cosmochemistry), how medications work (pharmacology), and how to collect DNA evidence at a crime scene (forensics).

6e5cf07b6906.key: The applications of various fields of chemistry
6e5cf07b6906.fact: The applications of various fields of chemistry are used frequently for economic purposes in the chemical industry.

10d67d16722c.fact: γ-Hydroxybutyraldehyde is the organic compound with the formula HOCH2CH2CH2CHO.

50832a22fd86.key: The compound occurs in nature and
50832a22fd86.fact: The compound occurs in nature and is produced commercially.

2d3b14ca93f3.key: Abu Rayhan Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-Biruni
2d3b14ca93f3.fact: Abu Rayhan Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-Biruni, known as al-Biruni (c.

abdcc2ee9164.fact: Al-Biruni was well versed in physics, mathematics, astronomy, and natural sciences; he also distinguished himself as a historian, chronologist, and linguist.

e23329ee56c9.key: He studied almost all the sciences of his day and
e23329ee56c9.fact: He studied almost all the sciences of his day and was rewarded abundantly for his tireless research in many fields of knowledge.

4fe9ccb2b118.key: Influential in his own right, al-Biruni
4fe9ccb2b118.fact: Influential in his own right, al-Biruni was himself influenced by the scholars of other nations, such as the Greeks, from whom he took inspiration when he turned to the study of philosophy.

a62b60736b02.fact: A gifted linguist, he was conversant in Khwarezmian, Persian, Arabic, and Sanskrit, and also knew Greek, Hebrew, and Syriac.

551d48458d02.fact: In 1017, he travelled to the Indian subcontinent and wrote a treatise on Indian culture entitled Tārīkh al-Hind ("The History of India"), after exploring the Hindu faith practiced in India.

80c18801f6ce.fact: Computer science is the study of computation, information, and automation.

e65f784a8f03.key: An expert in the field is
e65f784a8f03.fact: An expert in the field is known as a computer scientist.

cb9963e67c84.fact: Algorithms and data structures are central to computer science.

912ed452ed55.key: The fundamental concern of computer science
912ed452ed55.fact: The fundamental concern of computer science is determining what can and cannot be automated.

8a2faf9eb35e.fact: The Turing Award is generally recognized as the highest distinction in computer science.

4a1a68d6e461.fact: 2D computer graphics is the computer-based generation of digital images—mostly from two-dimensional models (such as 2D geometric models, text, and digital images) and by techniques specific to them.

81e43d5913ac.key: In those applications, the two-dimensional image
81e43d5913ac.fact: In those applications, the two-dimensional image is not just a representation of a real-world object, but an independent artifact with added semantic value; two-dimensional models are therefore preferred, because they give more direct control of the image than 3D computer graphics (whose approach is more akin to photography than to typography).

d28112515b1d.fact: This representation is also more flexible since it can be rendered at different resolutions to suit different output devices.

a563b31ceb86.key: For these reasons, documents and illustrations
a563b31ceb86.fact: For these reasons, documents and illustrations are often stored or transmitted as 2D graphic files.

69d0e5c9167c.key: The PostScript language and the X Window System pr
69d0e5c9167c.fact: The PostScript language and the X Window System protocol were landmark developments in the field.

d92cd15a5d62.fact: In object-oriented graphics, the image is described indirectly by an object endowed with a self-rendering method—a procedure that assigns colors to the image pixels by an arbitrary algorithm.

8b007b6e8f5a.fact: The ACM Computing Classification System (CCS) is a subject classification system for computing devised by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM).

9e4f38b4386b.fact: The system is comparable to the Mathematics Subject Classification (MSC) in scope, aims, and structure, being used by the various ACM journals to organize subjects by area.

bae4c73f6640.fact: The Internet (or internet) is the global system of interconnected computer networks that uses the Internet protocol suite (TCP/IP) to communicate between networks and devices.

0af1a6dd7ce8.key: The overarching definitions of the two principal n
0af1a6dd7ce8.fact: The overarching definitions of the two principal name spaces on the Internet, the Internet Protocol address (IP address) space and the Domain Name System (DNS), are directed by a maintainer organization, the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN).

d595f2d8a407.key: The technical underpinning and standardization of
d595f2d8a407.fact: The technical underpinning and standardization of the core protocols is an activity of the non-profit Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).

0771b4ef0e47.fact: In late February, there was another outage, this time affecting a fiber optic connection between Singapore and Jakarta.

5c92e061baa2.key: On December 19, FLAG FEA, GO-1, SEA-ME-WE 3, and S
5c92e061baa2.fact: On December 19, FLAG FEA, GO-1, SEA-ME-WE 3, and SEA-ME-WE 4 were all cut.

66098febaf3d.fact: On 22 May 2014, the Royal Thai Armed Forces, led by General Prayut Chan-o-cha, the commander-in-chief of the Royal Thai Army, launched a coup d'état, the twelfth since the country's first coup in 1932, against the caretaker government following six months of political crisis.

ca83261bc6dc.key: which had been present since the 2006 Thai coup d'
ca83261bc6dc.fact: The coup ended the political conflict between the military-led regime and democratic power, which had been present since the 2006 Thai coup d'état known as the "unfinished coup".

2f6ecbb3eb3f.key: In February 2021, government ministers Puttipong P
2f6ecbb3eb3f.fact: In February 2021, government ministers Puttipong Punnakanta, Nataphol Teepsuwan and Thaworn Senniam were found guilty of insurrection during protests that led to the 2014 coup d'état.

641b2b00d03f.fact: Electricity is the set of physical phenomena associated with the presence and motion of matter possessing an electric charge.

ae8b1cd055d2.fact: Common phenomena are related to electricity, including lightning, static electricity, electric heating, electric discharges and many others.

070dae400b6d.key: The motion of electric charge carriers
070dae400b6d.fact: The motion of electric charge carriers is an electric current and produces a magnetic field.

b0cf5d85e68b.fact: Electric potential is the work done to move an electric charge from one position to another within an electric field, typically measured in volts.

289c8e4f0fea.key: Electricity plays a central role in many modern te
289c8e4f0fea.fact: Electricity plays a central role in many modern technologies, serving in electric power where electric current is used to energise equipment, and in electronics dealing with electrical circuits involving active components such as vacuum tubes, transistors, diodes and integrated circuits, and associated passive interconnection technologies.

4d5a6506416d.key: This rapid expansion in electrical technology at t
4d5a6506416d.fact: This rapid expansion in electrical technology at the time was the driving force behind the Second Industrial Revolution, with electricity's versatility driving transformations in both industry and society.

a436749609b9.fact: The 28th century BC was a century that lasted from the year 2800 BC to 2701 BC.

e31859535973.fact: The AA battery (or double-A battery) is a standard-size single-cell cylindrical dry battery.

2b3fad130347.fact: Historically, it is known as D14 (hearing-aid battery), U12 – later U7 (standard cell), or HP7 (for zinc-chloride "high power" version) in official documentation in the United Kingdom, or a pen cell.

bacfc6781f99.fact: AA batteries are common in portable electronic devices.

962de892af1d.fact: An AA battery is composed of a single electrochemical cell that may be either a primary battery (disposable) or a rechargeable battery.

f7569721679d.fact: Several different chemistries are used in their construction.

2bb8d809d871.fact: Atoms are smaller than the shortest wavelength of visible light, which means humans cannot see atoms with conventional microscopes.

73bc9c46c044.fact: The chemical elements are distinguished from each other by the number of protons that are in their atoms.

58cf443e200c.key: For example, any atom that contains 11 protons
58cf443e200c.fact: For example, any atom that contains 11 protons is sodium, and any atom that contains 29 protons is copper.

fbe7b60eb9e2.key: Atoms with the same number of protons but a differ
fbe7b60eb9e2.fact: Atoms with the same number of protons but a different number of neutrons are called isotopes of the same element.

fed0d8ae82e6.fact: A human hair is about a million carbon atoms wide.

65d8fe3daca4.fact: More than 99.94% of an atom's mass is in the nucleus.

daf3447365e1.key: Protons have a positive electric charge and neutro
daf3447365e1.fact: Protons have a positive electric charge and neutrons have no charge, so the nucleus is positively charged.

96cdb384d2b4.fact: The electrons are negatively charged, and this opposing charge is what binds them to the nucleus.

eeb51e71c7da.key: If the numbers of protons and electrons
eeb51e71c7da.fact: If the numbers of protons and electrons are equal, as they normally are, then the atom is electrically neutral as a whole.

3ea9a53dbcff.fact: A charged atom is called an ion.

58b89e247d3c.key: If an atom has more electrons than protons, then i
58b89e247d3c.fact: If an atom has more electrons than protons, then it has an overall negative charge and is called a negative ion (or anion).

58c3f9c164a5.key: Conversely, if it has more protons than electrons,
58c3f9c164a5.fact: Conversely, if it has more protons than electrons, it has a positive charge and is called a positive ion (or cation).

c8ffe8b99fbc.fact: The electrons of an atom are attracted to the protons in an atomic nucleus by the electromagnetic force.

62ff48ca6f0b.key: The protons and neutrons in the nucleus
62ff48ca6f0b.fact: The protons and neutrons in the nucleus are attracted to each other by the nuclear force.

fd22160ac041.fact: This force is usually stronger than the electromagnetic force that repels the positively charged protons from one another.

4722a53fbc11.key: The ability of atoms to attach and detach from eac
4722a53fbc11.fact: The ability of atoms to attach and detach from each other is responsible for most of the physical changes observed in nature.

55a2cf58ba8d.fact: Absolute zero is the lowest theoretically possible temperature, a state at which a system's internal energy, and in ideal cases entropy, reach their minimum values.

b4ae4ad0af8f.fact: The Kelvin scale is defined so that absolute zero is 0 K, equivalent to −273.15 °C on the Celsius scale, and −459.67 °F on the Fahrenheit scale.

8d18ed0e147f.fact: In 2018, scientists at the University of Bremen achieved temperatures as low as 38 picokelvin (pK).

6ef4ab5b08c7.fact: In spectroscopy, an absorption band is a range of wavelengths, frequencies or energies in the electromagnetic spectrum that are characteristic of a particular transition from initial to final state in a substance.

32cc8495be55.key: When such quanta of electromagnetic radiation
32cc8495be55.fact: When such quanta of electromagnetic radiation are emitted or absorbed by an atom or molecule, energy of the radiation changes the state of the atom or molecule from an initial state to a final state.

51b612238858.fact: The Moon is the brightest celestial object in Earth's night sky because of its large apparent size, while the reflectance (albedo) of its surface is comparable to that of asphalt.

1978f43ac0ce.fact: The Moon and Earth are bound by gravitational attraction, which is stronger on the sides facing each other.

46e5140cd3c1.fact: The resulting tidal forces are the main driver of Earth's tides, and have pulled the Moon to always face Earth with the same near side.

5ed211b43fe5.fact: In geophysical terms, the Moon is a planetary-mass object or satellite planet.

3bbc34c07d17.fact: Its mass is 1.2% that of the Earth, and its diameter is 3,474 km (2,159 mi), roughly one-quarter of Earth's (about as wide as the contiguous United States).

3619768886ed.fact: Within the Solar System, it is larger and more massive than any known dwarf planet, and the fifth-largest and fifth-most massive moon, as well as the largest and most massive in relation to its parent planet.

3ea94e3dd80d.fact: Its surface gravity is about one-sixth of Earth's, about half that of Mars, and the second-highest among all moons in the Solar System after Jupiter's moon Io.

69b9d4d5cd2e.fact: The body of the Moon is differentiated and terrestrial, with only a minuscule hydrosphere, atmosphere, and magnetic field.

1c27058c3c23.fact: The lunar surface is covered in regolith dust, which mainly consists of the fine material ejected from the lunar crust by impact events.

e8f0a436fb67.fact: The lunar crust is marked by impact craters, with some younger ones featuring bright ray-like streaks.

a1d73dfcf680.fact: The origin of the Moon is not clear, although it has been hypothesized to have formed out of material from Earth, ejected by a giant impact into Earth of a Mars-sized body named Theia 4.51 billion years ago, not long after Earth's formation.

5a3796451b87.key: From a distance, the day and night phases of the l
5a3796451b87.fact: From a distance, the day and night phases of the lunar day are visible as the lunar phases, and when the Moon passes through Earth's shadow a lunar eclipse is observable.

54e5a4b899ec.key: The Moon's apparent size in Earth's sky
54e5a4b899ec.fact: The Moon's apparent size in Earth's sky is about the same as that of the Sun, which causes it to cover the Sun completely during a total solar eclipse.

d19768e6f4e8.key: About 59% of the surface of the Moon
d19768e6f4e8.fact: About 59% of the surface of the Moon is visible from Earth owing to the different angles at which the Moon can appear in Earth's sky (libration), making parts of the far side of the Moon visible.

b59a0f9f0c5e.fact: The first spaceflights to an extraterrestrial body were to the Moon, starting in 1959 with the flyby of Luna 1 (sent by the Soviet Union), and the intentional impact of Luna 2, followed in 1966 by the first soft landing (by Luna 9) and orbital insertion (by Luna 10).

e0323a9039ad.fact: (136617) 1994 CC is a sub-kilometer triple asteroid, classified as a near-Earth object and potentially hazardous asteroid of the Apollo group.

e4000a0ae4f7.fact: (153591) 2001 SN263 is a carbonaceous triple asteroid, classified as near-Earth object and former potentially hazardous asteroid of the Amor group, approximately 2.6 kilometers (1.6 miles) in diameter.

68834fdcdff2.fact: Mars is an often proposed target for future crewed exploration missions, though no such mission is currently planned.

5b7dee74d217.fact: It is also known as the "Red Planet", for its orange-red appearance.

7f5306a302ed.key: At the average surface level the atmospheric press
7f5306a302ed.fact: At the average surface level the atmospheric pressure is a few thousandths of Earth's, atmospheric temperature ranges from −153 to 20 °C (−243 to 68 °F), and cosmic radiation is high.

07af2975a596.fact: Its diameter, 6,779 km (4,212 mi), is about half the Earth's, or twice the Moon's, and its surface area is the size of all the dry land of Earth.

2d03125d695c.fact: Fine dust is prevalent across the surface and the atmosphere, being picked up and spread at the low Martian gravity even by the weak wind of the tenuous atmosphere.

4b19fd4eee1b.fact: Geologically, the planet is fairly active with marsquakes trembling underneath the ground, but also hosts many enormous volcanoes that are extinct (the tallest is Olympus Mons, 21.9 km or 13.6 mi tall), as well as one of the largest canyons in the Solar System (Valles Marineris, 4,000 km or 2,500 mi long).

28ab3a6ffb70.key: Mars has two natural satellites that
28ab3a6ffb70.fact: Mars has two natural satellites that are small and irregular in shape: Phobos and Deimos.

6c3f35b02074.fact: A Martian solar year is equal to 1.88 Earth years (687 Earth days), a Martian solar day (sol) is equal to 24.6 hours.

bb8e8cd183e2.fact: During the martian Noachian period (4.5 to 3.5 billion years ago), its surface was marked by meteor impacts, valley formation, erosion, the possible presence of water oceans and the loss of its magnetosphere.

1a843cc71098.fact: The Hesperian period (beginning 3.5 billion years ago and ending 3.3–2.9 billion years ago) was dominated by widespread volcanic activity and flooding that carved immense outflow channels.

356943ad3fd0.key: The Amazonian period, which continues to the prese
356943ad3fd0.fact: The Amazonian period, which continues to the present, is the currently dominating and remaining influence on geological processes.

3f5ea22c8d4b.fact: In 1963 the first flight to Mars took place with Mars 1, but communication was lost en route.

25b700b07308.fact: The first successful flyby exploration of Mars was conducted in 1965 with Mariner 4.

c3840c0b6f7b.fact: In 1971 Mariner 9 entered orbit around Mars, being the first spacecraft to orbit any body other than the Moon, Sun or Earth; following in the same year were the first uncontrolled impact (Mars 2) and first successful landing (Mars 3) on Mars.

91e38f1f7eef.fact: (101429) 1998 VF31 (provisional designation 1998 VF31) is a sub-kilometer asteroid that orbits near Mars's L5 Lagrangian point, on average trailing 60° behind it.

dd9064f18203.fact: Its orbit is highly stable, and was originally thought to be spectroscopically similar to 5261 Eureka, suggesting they may both be primordial Martian asteroids.

c5b13918cf63.fact: (121514) 1999 UJ7 is a small asteroid orbiting near the L4 point of Mars (60 degrees ahead Mars on its orbit).

a38323d3efff.fact: As of April 2024, it is one of only two known asteroids to orbit the leading L4 point of Mars—the other being 2023 FW14—although at least 15 other asteroids orbit Mars's trailing L5 point: The largest being 5261 Eureka, (101429) 1998 VF31, and 2007 NS2.

10c27b01535d.key: Not only does (121514) 1999 UJ7 orbit on the other
10c27b01535d.fact: Not only does (121514) 1999 UJ7 orbit on the other side of Mars from other similar asteroids, its spectrum is different as well, which is puzzling because all of the Martian trojans seem to be in very stable orbits.

27a5148ea0fb.fact: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun, and the largest in the Solar System.

a5ea9692e4ee.fact: Its diameter is 11 times that of Earth and a tenth that of the Sun.

f7fec5ff09fb.fact: Jupiter's helium abundance is 80% of the Sun's, similar to Saturn's composition.

3553a37fea66.fact: The outer atmosphere is divided into a series of latitudinal bands, with turbulence and storms along their interacting boundaries; the most obvious result of this is the Great Red Spot, a giant storm that has been recorded since 1831.

ff9c502dd1e1.key: Because of its rapid rotation rate, one turn in te
ff9c502dd1e1.fact: Because of its rapid rotation rate, one turn in ten hours, Jupiter is an oblate spheroid; it has a slight but noticeable 6.5% bulge around the equator compared to its poles.

751c4dca9968.fact: Its internal structure is believed to consist of an outer mantle of fluid metallic hydrogen and a diffuse inner core of denser material.

dc3b4305d7c1.fact: Jupiter's magnetic field is the strongest and second-largest contiguous structure in the Solar System, generated by eddy currents within the fluid, metallic hydrogen core.

682b9e9fd705.key: At least 97 moons orbit the planet; the four large
682b9e9fd705.fact: At least 97 moons orbit the planet; the four largest moons—Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto—orbit within the magnetosphere and are visible with common binoculars.

4d2e24563a02.key: Ganymede, the largest of the four,
4d2e24563a02.fact: Ganymede, the largest of the four, is larger than the planet Mercury.

8989c55b1b2b.key: The rings of Jupiter consist mainly of dust and ha
8989c55b1b2b.fact: The rings of Jupiter consist mainly of dust and have three main segments: an inner torus of particles known as the halo, a relatively bright main ring, and an outer gossamer ring.

0d1dcadc9b8a.key: The age of the ring system
0d1dcadc9b8a.fact: The age of the ring system is unknown, possibly dating back to Jupiter's formation.

a9c2859697c2.fact: 23 April 1564 – 23 April 1616) was an English playwright, poet and actor.

258772c1e4f4.key: His plays have been translated into every major li
258772c1e4f4.fact: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.

50d299d6d796.fact: Shakespeare was born and raised in Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire.

c18788c2f274.fact: Sometime between 1585 and 1592 he began a successful career in London as an actor, writer, and part-owner ("sharer") of a playing company called the Lord Chamberlain's Men, later known as the King's Men after the ascension of King James VI of Scotland to the English throne.

5f246b0f8e21.key: Few records of Shakespeare's private life survive;
5f246b0f8e21.fact: Few records of Shakespeare's private life survive; this has stimulated considerable speculation about such matters as his physical appearance, his sexuality, his religious beliefs and even certain fringe theories as to whether the works attributed to him were written by others.

6c058eb3058d.fact: His early plays were primarily comedies and histories and are regarded as some of the best works produced in these genres.

ad86ea10f933.key: In the last phase of his life he wrote tragicomedi
ad86ea10f933.fact: In the last phase of his life he wrote tragicomedies (also known as romances) such as The Winter's Tale and The Tempest, and collaborated with other playwrights.

62cacc3e7b75.fact: Many of Shakespeare's plays were published in editions of varying quality and accuracy during his lifetime.

dcf83873e8bf.fact: However, in 1623 John Heminges and Henry Condell, two fellow actors and friends of Shakespeare's, published a more definitive text known as the First Folio, a posthumous collected edition of Shakespeare's dramatic works that includes 36 of his plays.

5b7469905a5d.fact: & Juliet is a 2019 jukebox musical featuring the music of Swedish pop songwriter Max Martin, with a book by David West Read, in which Anne Hathaway negotiates with her husband, William Shakespeare, to change the ending to Romeo and Juliet so that Juliet does not kill herself.

47c479cbd3d2.fact: The 2022 Broadway production was nominated for nine Tony Awards, but did not win any.

de3af6a570dd.fact: "(Don't Fear) The Reaper" is a song by the American rock band Blue Öyster Cult from the 1976 album Agents of Fortune.

c22c923ca08b.key: Released as an edited single (omitting the slow bu
c22c923ca08b.fact: Released as an edited single (omitting the slow building interlude in the original), the song is Blue Öyster Cult's highest chart success, reaching #7 in Cash Box and #12 on the Billboard Hot 100 in late 1976.

e3ce917f5c3f.fact: Critical reception was positive and in December 2003 "(Don't Fear) The Reaper" was listed at number 405 on Rolling Stone's list of the top 500 songs of all time.

972887f2ba79.fact: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (27 January 1756 – 5 December 1791) was a Classical composer and musician.

7fdfa4424fb1.fact: At age five, he was already competent on keyboard and violin, had begun to compose, and had performed before European royalty.

1494ce935b71.fact: At 17 he was a musician at the Salzburg court but grew restless and travelled in search of a better position.

efe9d08d6ab6.fact: While he was visiting Vienna in 1781, Mozart's quarrels with his Salzburg employers came to a head and he was dismissed.

4e937ed1a053.fact: The Requiem was largely unfinished at the time of his death at age 35.

e32b28b7ecfc.fact: These changes were a result of emerging modern ideals of selfhood, the declining fashionability of highly elaborate Rococo styles, and the widespread embrace of the rationalistic or "classical" ideals of Enlightenment philosophes.

1a9e1f194ca7.key: The ABRSM (Associated Board of the Royal Schools o
1a9e1f194ca7.fact: The ABRSM (Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music) is an examination board and registered charity based in the United Kingdom.

d54aefa67b0d.fact: ABRSM is one of the UK's 200 largest charitable organisations ranked by annual expenditure.

683575bf753f.fact: 'The Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music' was established in 1889 and rebranded as ABRSM in 2009.

72122bc925c9.key: The clarifying strapline "the exam board of the Ro
72122bc925c9.fact: The clarifying strapline "the exam board of the Royal Schools of Music" was introduced in 2012.

6688f9981319.key: Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci (15 April 1452 – 2
6688f9981319.fact: Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci (15 April 1452 – 2 May 1519) was an Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who was active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect.

020e60c6a84d.fact: Leonardo is widely regarded as a genius who epitomised the Renaissance humanist ideal, and his collective works contributed to the development of European art to an extent rivalled only by that of his younger contemporary Michelangelo.

e8f3bc13c1d8.key: Born out of wedlock to a successful notary and a l
e8f3bc13c1d8.fact: Born out of wedlock to a successful notary and a lower-class woman in, or near, Vinci, he was educated in Florence by the Italian painter and sculptor Andrea del Verrocchio.

cc8590bd8eac.key: Death of Upon the invitation of Francis I, he spent his last three years in France, where he
cc8590bd8eac.fact: Upon the invitation of Francis I, he spent his last three years in France, where he died in 1519.

712868c09861.key: Despite having many lost works and fewer than 25 a
712868c09861.fact: Despite having many lost works and fewer than 25 attributed major works – including numerous unfinished works – he created some of the most influential paintings in the Western canon.

572c1f975ca2.fact: The Mona Lisa is his best known work and is regarded as the world's most famous individual painting.

8326d90f3266.fact: The Last Supper is the most reproduced religious painting of all time and his Vitruvian Man drawing is also regarded as a cultural icon.

255b693e7b59.fact: In 2017, Salvator Mundi, attributed in whole or part to Leonardo, was sold at auction for US$450.3 million, setting a new record for the most expensive painting ever sold at public auction.

a5334598dc78.fact: Relatively few of his designs were constructed or were even feasible during his lifetime, as the modern scientific approaches to metallurgy and engineering were only in their infancy during the Renaissance.

68ee4cf02837.key: A Treatise on Painting (Trattato della pittura)
68ee4cf02837.fact: A Treatise on Painting (Trattato della pittura) is a collection of Leonardo da Vinci's writings entered in his notebooks under the general heading "On Painting".

1e12bc9b69f5.fact: The manuscripts were begun in Milan while Leonardo was under the service of Ludovico Sforza and gathered together by his heir Francesco Melzi.

e944012b76e7.key: An abridged version of the treatise
e944012b76e7.fact: An abridged version of the treatise was first published in France in 1651.

e2bf9304da99.fact: After Melzi's manuscript was rediscovered in the Vatican Library, the treatise was published in its modern form in 1817.

71440212f777.fact: (doing business as Amazon) is an American multinational technology company engaged in e-commerce, cloud computing, online advertising, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence.

d1c05d2b68b3.fact: Founded in 1994 by Jeff Bezos in Bellevue, Washington, the company originally started as an online marketplace for books, but gradually expanded its offerings to include a wide range of product categories, referred to as "The Everything Store".

cea3ac73011c.fact: It is mostly known as the world's biggest online shopping retailer and marketplace, best known for a wide range of products and supplying multiple services.

83dd95e620d6.fact: As of 2023, it is the world's largest online retailer and marketplace, smart speaker provider, cloud computing service through AWS, live-streaming service through Twitch, and Internet company as measured by revenue and market share.

fc3d88cf59dc.fact: In 2021, it surpassed Walmart as the world's largest retailer outside of China, driven in large part by its paid subscription plan, Amazon Prime, which has 200 million subscribers worldwide.

8d8e908799e2.fact: As of October 2024, Amazon is the 12th-most visited website in the world and 84% of its traffic comes from the United States.

b6bb43df4525.fact: .ae is the country code top-level domain (ccTLD) in the Domain Name System of the Internet for the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

90efd32931d9.key: The internationalized country code top-level domai
90efd32931d9.fact: The internationalized country code top-level domain in the Arabic alphabet of the UAE is امارات., which is romanized as emarat.

8bcc25c96aa5.fact: .au is the Internet country code top-level domain (ccTLD) for Australia.

6bbd5fd1da14.fact: Domain name policy is managed by .au Domain Administration (auDA).

4c296102cc0c.fact: As of July 2018, the registry is operated by Afilias.

9a29dec44eee.fact: Google LLC ( , GOO-gəl) is an American multinational technology corporation focused on information technology, online advertising, search engine technology, email, cloud computing, software, quantum computing, e-commerce, consumer electronics, and artificial intelligence (AI).

899f97797ceb.key: It has been referred to as "the most powerful comp
899f97797ceb.fact: It has been referred to as "the most powerful company in the world" by BBC, and is one of the world's most valuable brands.

bb7cf62fb07e.fact: Google was founded on September 4, 1998, by American computer scientists Larry Page and Sergey Brin.

7e43d7f76c79.fact: In 2015, Google was reorganized as a wholly owned subsidiary of Alphabet Inc.

c822c1b63853.fact: Google is the largest provider of search engines, mapping and navigation applications, email services, office suites, online video platforms, photo and cloud storage, mobile operating systems, web browsers, machine learning frameworks, and AI virtual assistants in the world as measured by market share.

654ba0fc1cc5.fact: Sundar Pichai was appointed CEO of Google on October 24, 2015, replacing Larry Page, who became the CEO of Alphabet.

0c27bcb9f3e2.key: Many of these products and services
0c27bcb9f3e2.fact: Many of these products and services are dominant in their respective industries, as is Google Search.

364cb94355b8.fact: Google Search and YouTube are the two most-visited websites worldwide, followed by Facebook, Instagram, and ChatGPT.

8530cdddc2ef.key: On the list of the most valuable brands, Google
8530cdddc2ef.fact: On the list of the most valuable brands, Google is ranked second by Forbes as of January 2022, and is fourth by Interbrand as of February 2022.

d2a57dc1d883.fact: .app is a generic top-level domain (gTLD) in ICANN's New gTLD Program.

832b62679772.fact: The TLD is of interest due to its utility in regards to branding mobile, web, and other applications.

e77989ed2175.fact: .dev is a top-level domain name operated by Google Registry.
